page.title: 04GLENLIVET FEED PLANT
page.content: This factory was built in the early 1970's to make animal feed from the waste materials of whisky distilling - pot ale and draff (which is itself a good animal feed). These are processed in the factory to form dark grain pellets which are rich in protein. The plant is highly mechanised and only requires an operating staff of 12 men. The pellets are sold to agricultural food firms to be used as part of their compounds and a small percentage is sold directly to local farmers but the export market, particularly Germany buys most. The plant is owned by the Canadian company, Seagrams, and waste material from many of their distilleries is processed here. Housing is available locally along with the distillery workers.
